content:
Diagnosis:		Dysembryoplastic neuroepithelial tumour (DNET) of right temporal lobe

Management:		Partial resection March 2023

Histology:		WHO Grade I DNET, CD34 positive

Current situation:	Routine surveillance

[redacted name] attended today's Neuro-oncology follow-up clinic. She remains seizure-free on Levetiracetam 750mg BD, which she tolerates well. Her most recent MRI brain (15/4/24) shows stable appearances of the residual right temporal DNET with no new features of concern. Her neurological examination remains normal with no focal deficits. Performance status is 0. She continues to work full-time and maintains good quality of life. The plan is to continue current anti-epileptic medication and arrange repeat MRI brain in 6 months with clinic review thereafter. She understands to contact us sooner if new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: Partial resection of right temporal DNET
MRI brain shows stable appearances of residual right temporal DNET with no new features

patient_facts.value: Normal neurological examination with no focal deficits
Working full-time and maintains good quality of life

status_updates.value: WHO Grade I DNET status post partial resection. Stable disease on surveillance with good seizure control
Continuing Levetiracetam 750mg BD with good tolerance
